conclusion: Problem involves an ideal gas changing from state A to C, need to find temperature at state C.
Diagram with pressure on y-axis, volume on x-axis; points A (V₀, p₀), B (V₀, 0.6p₀), C (0.5V₀, 0.6p₀).
Temperature at state A is T₀, internal energy U = aT.
Use ideal gas law PV = nRT, n is constant.
Process goes from A to B to C; A to B: constant volume, pressure decreases; B to C: constant pressure, volume decreases.
At point A: p₀ * V₀ = nRT₀.
From A to B: volume constant, T proportional to P, T₁ = 0.6T₀.
From B to C: pressure constant, T₂ = (p₂ * V₂ * T₀) / (p₀ * V₀).
Verification of T₂ calculation using PV/T constant.
Alternative reasoning: From B to C, T₂ = T₁ * (V₂ / V₁) = 0.6T₀ * 0.5.
